author: cmpilato
msg: Wow.  Before this change, running `fs-test 29' would max out at around
60 megs of memory usage.  Now?  10 megs.  A modified `fs-test 29' that
uses test files of WINDOW_SIZE*3+1 (instead of the current WINDOW_SIZE+1)
used to crash my system, now it completes (albeit after 3.3 minutes)
with a max memory consumption of around 27 megs.  Win, win, win.
* reps-strings.c
(rep_read_range): Use a subpool in this function.

author: cmpilato
msg: * fs-test.c
(undeltify_deltify): Use a subpool during the setup phase of this
test.

author: sussman
msg: * svn_version.h (SVN_VER_TAG): Brane, I have no idea how the code can
possibly know its own revision; but I do know that seeing "M3
(r196)" all the time is confusing newbies.  And nobody wants to
update this number before each commit.  Commenting out for now.
(Maybe autogen.sh or configure can derive the value someday?)

author: cmpilato
msg: grrr.... turn off deltification...again

author: cmpilato
msg: * include/svn_pools.h
(SVN_POOL_DEBUG): Dangit.  Forgot some stuff.
* tests/clients/cmdline/svntest/main.py
(run_tests): Python for Perl-heads, by G. Stein.  Use print
formatting, the Right Way.
